Package com.advertisementproject.zuulgateway.security.Utils

Class JwtUtils

java.lang.Object
com.advertisementproject.zuulgateway.security.Utils.JwtUtils
@Service
public class JwtUtils
extends java.lang.Object
Utilities class for creating JSON Web Tokens (JWT) and extracting the subject from them

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Long EXPIRATION_VALUE
    Value for how many hours a jwt token should last before it expires.
    private java.lang.String JWT_SECRET
    Secret key for signing jwt tokens and extracting data from a jwt token.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor Description
    JwtUtils()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String createToken​(UserDetailsImpl userDetails)
    Creates a jwt token that expires in 24 hours with authorities from user details as claims and user id from user details as subject.
    java.lang.String extractSubject​(java.lang.String token)
    Extracts the subject (user id in our case) from a jwt token.
    private java.util.Date generateExpirationDate()
    Helper method for generating an expiration date

      private final java.lang.Long EXPIRATION_VALUE
      Value for how many hours a jwt token should last before it expires.

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtUtils

  • Method Details

    • extractSubject

      public java.lang.String extractSubject​(java.lang.String token)
      Extracts the subject (user id in our case) from a jwt token.
      Parameters:
      token - the token to extract the subject (user id) from
      Returns:
      the extracted subject (user id)
      Throws:
      io.jsonwebtoken.ExpiredJwtException - if the token is expired
      io.jsonwebtoken.UnsupportedJwtException - if the jwt token format is not supported
      io.jsonwebtoken.MalformedJwtException - if the jwt token is malformed, typically not including exactly 2 periods
      io.jsonwebtoken.SignatureException - if the jwt token signature is invalid
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is not a valid string

    • createToken

      public java.lang.String createToken​(UserDetailsImpl userDetails)
      Creates a jwt token that expires in 24 hours with authorities from user details as claims and user id from user details as subject. Signs the token using a HS256 signature algorithm and a secret key.
      Parameters:
      userDetails - user details to get subject and claims from
      Returns:
      a signed 24 hour token based on user details which can be used to authenticate requests

    • generateExpirationDate

      private java.util.Date generateExpirationDate()
      Helper method for generating an expiration date
      Returns:
      expiration timestamp 24 hours later than current timestamp
